decks.notes: This deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana for powerful Eldrazi creatures and cards like Karn, the Great Creator. It focuses on controlling the board through cards like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn, while also using Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck has a high mana curve with heavy hitters like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and World Breaker to close out the game. Boseiju, Who Endures can ensure that important spells resolve, making it difficult for opponents to counter your game-winning plays.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to apply consistent early pressure on the opponent using efficient and aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Lightning Bolt and Chained to the Rocks. Additionally, the deck utilizes Aether Hub for mana fixing and boasts a mana base that can support cards like Blood Moon to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently with a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Modern deck is to assemble a variety of creatures through the use of Chord of Calling and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to create a toolbox of options. These creatures, such as Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, are used to control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and generate value through various abilities. By utilizing a mix of utility creatures, removal spells like Malevolent Rumble, and powerful synergies, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue the opponent to secure a win.

The deck focuses on using a variety of spells to control the opponent's actions and resources while maintaining board presence. It utilizes a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect itself. The key strategy is to efficiently remove threats and counter key spells while deploying threats of its own, such as Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and controlling the pace of the game to ultimately secure a win through attrition.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal spells. It also utilizes card advantage and manipulation to control the pace of the game. The deck includes a mix of versatile creatures like Psychic Frog and powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. With a strong mana base and a variety of ways to disrupt the opponent's plans, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until it can establish a board presence and secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to bring out cheap and powerful creatures like Hollow One and Nethergoyf. Utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith to manipulate the graveyard and enable large creatures to be played for minimal cost. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and utilize cards like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push for removal and disruption. The synergy between cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ox of Agonas allows for consistent card advantage and pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like All Is Dust and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to clear threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes ramp cards like Eldrazi Temple and Talisman of Impulse to quickly get out its big threats like Ulamog, the Defiler and Devourer of Destiny. The deck aims to establish early game control and finish off the opponent with massive Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul or Ulamog.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful counterspells and removal spells to protect The One Ring, a powerful artifact that gives you an advantage over your opponent. By utilizing card draw effects and versatile spells like Force of Negation and Supreme Verdict, you can maintain board control and disrupt your opponent's strategy. With the support of planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and cards like Tune the Narrative, you can manipulate the game to your advantage and secure victory by overwhelming your opponent with your control strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Cascade mechanic to cast powerful creatures for free, while also cycling through your deck with cards like Street Wraith and Shardless Agent. By controlling the board with counterspells like Force of Negation and disrupting your opponent's strategy with Endurance and Subtlety, you can set up for a game-winning Living End to bring back all of your creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of card advantage, disruptive creatures, and a powerful combo finish.

The deck focuses on using control elements to protect and utilize The One Ring artifact, which is the key win condition. By countering threats and controlling the board with spells like Wrath of the Skies and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to stall the game until The One Ring can be equipped to a creature, granting immense power and potentially closing out the game quickly. The deck also includes versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Teferi, Time Raveler to handle a variety of situations and maintain control over the game.

The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption effects. By using cards like Force of Negation, Counterspell, and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from resolving key threats. Additionally, cards like Psychic Frog and Murktide Regent provide a win condition by applying pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes Cling to Dust and Otawara, Soaring City for additional card advantage and deck manipulation.
